items.q: What is the narrative hook? Write the hook here.
What do you think the mood of this story is? What feeling or atmosphere does this story create?
What verb tense is most commonly used in "My Difficult Day?"
Is the story arranged in chronological order? If so, describe what happened first, second, and so on.
Read the last sentence of the story. Does the story end with a moral, prediction, or a revelation?
Bob was writing his first mystery novel. He was reminded of his beloved grandfather. His grandfather used to read mystery novels often. (while)
Sarah first weeded the flower bed and watered the grass. She planted daisies, tulips, and roses. (before)
Karen worked on her school work during the day. She went to work in the evenings. (after)
Hundreds of people attended the author's speech. The author visited the town to give a speech about his most popular book. (when)
She enjoyed her fast-paced job. Karen also devoted some of her time to volunteer work. (while)
Once Upon a time, Cinderella live with a evil stepmother and two cruel stepsisters.
For many year she work as a servant for her stepmothers and stepsisters.
One day the king decides it is time for his son, Prince charming, to be finding a wife.
The king announces he to have a royal ball in two weeks
One weeks later, cinderella receive an invitation to the ball?
Choose the best answer. a. interesting foods b. The most disgusting meal that you have ever eaten
Choose the best answer. a. going to the airport b. getting stuck in the airport during a major snowstorm
Choose the best answer. a. meeting my favorite singer b. popular singers
Choose the best answer. a. my birthday b. my most memorable birthday party
Choose the best answer. a. the first day at new job b. a new job
Cassandra was the President of the Student Council _____ she transferred to another school.
I can't have lunch with you now, but I can _____ the afternoon.
John broke his arm in August, and two months _____ they took his cast off.
The toddler burned her finger on the hot stove, so _____ she wouldn't go near it.
_____ it starts to thunder, my dog hides underneath the bed.
an uncomfortable _____
to _____ the truth
a steep _____
_____ for help
to trip _____ something
a _____ counter
an uneven _____
to _____ sense of something
a deserted _____
to rush _____ the stairs
There are ten stores on this residential street.
Winning the lottery was a great misfortune .
We stood and gazed at the snow-covered mountains.
Comedians often scowl when they are telling jokes.
My brother is a true baseball enthusiast . He has to watch every game of the season.
"Happy Babies" is a somber film about early childhood.
It took two months for my broken leg to heal .
Olympic runners often shuffle to the finish line in a race.
When Ed's mother caught him stealing cookies from the cookie jar, he knew he was in a predicament .
My boss scolded me and told me I was doing a great job.
The location where the action in a story happens is called the plot .
The basic idea or moral of a story is its theme .
The feeling or atmosphere that a writer creates for a story is the setting .
The people in a story are referred to as characters .
What happens in the story, the sequence of events, is called the mood .
Many children don't really like vegetables.
On the second morning of my camping trip, I awoke to the sounds of trees rustling overhead, birds chirping, and a giant bear walking through the middle of my camp.
I swam in the warm ocean water for hours, and then I realized that I could no longer see my large, shiny sailboat.
It is very interesting to watch sculptors make a sculpture.
As I walked through the dark and empty cave, I suddenly saw two large eyes staring back at me.
I love to read.
